thread.title: Which North East coastal resort was judged second best in the UK for a staycation

title: Which North East coastal resort was judged second best in the UK for a staycation
text:

A North East town has been named the second best coastal resort in the UK for a ‘staycation’. 
Bamburgh in Northumberland is just kept off top spot by Southwold in Suffolk in a list of 40. 
And there’s further good news for the region as Tynemouth in North Tyneside also scored very highly with judges, coming in at 12th spot. 
It could mean a boost for the region’s economy too as the number of people shunning foreign deals for a holiday in the UK reportedly rose by 10% in 2017, with many resorts and B&B’s having enjoyed a surge in bookings. A cricket match is played beneath Bamburgh Castle (Image: PA) 
And that trend could yet continue post-Brexit as the pound becomes weaker making holidays abroad more expensive. 
Research for the top 40 list was carried out by credit card company Marbles for which it took into account a range of factors collated from data gathered by the likes of Trivago, Airbnb and TripAdvisor. Read More Photographers are overstepping the mark in trying to picture iconic Bamburgh Castle 
These included hotel and accommodation prices, the weather, average taxi fare, and how good the beach was. 
The amount of restaurants, pubs, amusements, attractions and fish and chips shops, were also graded, calculated per 1,000 head of population. A family run down the dunes to Bamburgh beach (Image: iStockphoto) 
In its ranking, Bamburgh got top marks for the quality of the beach while it also scored highly for the number of pubs and fish and chip shops. 
It also got respectable score for the number attractions and restaurants. Read More 
Overall it beat off the much better nationally known seaside town in Cornwall and Devon like Padstow, and Salcombe. 
Meanwhile Tynemouth also got top marks for its beach, while it scored well for accommodation costs. 
It topped places like Blackpool, Bournemouth, Torquay and St Ives. Like us on Facebook
